services.description: List all Oracle Java Cloud Service instances

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

skipBackupOnTerminate.description: Should backup be skipped. Default is 'true'.

force.description: When selected, if any errors occur while deleting schemas created by the service infrastructure, the delete will continue even if an error occurs. All script failures during deletion will also be ignored. Any undeleted schemas should be deleted manually. Default is 'false'.

delete-service.example: psm JaaS delete-service -s ExampleInstance -d dbaName -a dbaPassword

patch.description: This operation will apply a patch to the service

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

additionalNote.description: Provide notes to describe the patching operation.

precheck-patch.description: This operation will run a precheck for a patch on the given service

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

rollback.description: This operation will rollback a previously applied patch

view-backups.description: List all backups of Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

view-backup.description: List a backup of Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance
Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

databaseIncluded.description: Should Database be included in backup(not available for exadata DB). Default is 'false'.

full.description: Should a full backup be submitted (deprecated - use backupType instead). Default is 'true'.

keepForever.description: Prevent the automatic deletion of the backup after the retention period has elapsed. Default is 'false'.

view-restores.description: List all restore operations for Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

view-restore.description: List a specified restore operation for Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

restore.description: Restore the service from a backup

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

restoreConfig.description: Specify true to restore configuration files. Default is 'true'.

resetBinaries.description: Specify true to reset binary files to the current PSU level. Default is 'false'.

forceScaleIn.description: Specify true to automaticall scale in Managed Servers which are not included in the backup being restored. Default is 'false'.

continueOnError.description: Specify the error condition to be handled during script execution

restoreType.description: The type of recovery to perform

originalWLSAdminUser.description: Weblogic user name of original service

originalWLSAdminPassword.description: Weblogic admin password of original service

cloudStoragePassword.description: Password for the storage container user.

cloudStorageUser.description: Name for the storage container user.

originalEncryptionPassword.description: Encryption password if the backup was encrypted

backupId.description: ID of the backup to be restored

restoreId.description: The Id to be used for restore

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

backupId.description: ID of the backup to be deleted

force.description: Force delete a backup created by the patching process. Default is 'false'.

update-backup-config.description: Update the backup configuration for the service

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

config-payload.description: Path to JSON file containing payload for this command. A sample payload is included in EXAMPLES below.

add-backup-service.description: Enable the backup support for this service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

cloudStorageContainer.description: The storage container describes the location in the cloud where the service will be backed up to.

add-backup-service.example: psm JaaS add-backup-service -s ExampleInstance -k backupDestination -d cloudStorageContainer

import.description: AppToCloud import for Java Cloud Service

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

config-payload.description: Path to JSON file containing payload for this command. A sample payload is included in EXAMPLES below.

operation-status.description: View status of Oracle Java Cloud Service instance operation

activities.description: View activities for Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance

fromStartDate.description: Get activities that were created after this date. Can be used along with 'toStartDate' to get activities created within a date range. Supported date formats are yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss and yyyy-MM-dd

toStartDate.description: Get activities that were created before this date. Can be used along with 'fromStartDate' to get activities created within a date range. Supported date formats are yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss and yyyy-MM-dd

limitRowCount.description: Maximum number of activities to display. Default is 10.

offset.description: Include activities starting at this position in the result set. 'offset' in combination with 'limitRowCount' allows to get a subset of activities.

orderBy.description: Order by filter criteria. Supported format is fieldName:(asc/desc).
